sim.base_models.doc: The classes that make up the core simulator.

sim.base_models.Item.doc: Represents objects that can be transmitted over a network (e.g. blocks, messages).

sim.base_models.Item.__init__.doc:
Create an Item object.

  • sender_id (str): Id of the sender node. Can be used as a return address.
  • size (float): size of the item in bytes.

sim.base_models.Block.__init__.doc:
Create a Block object.

  • miner (Node): Node that created the block.
  • prev_id (str): Id of the block this block was mined on top of.
  • height (int): Height of the block in the blockchain.

sim.base_models.Packet.doc: Wrapper class for transmitting Item objects over the network.

sim.base_models.Packet.__init__.doc:
Create a Packet object.

  • payload (Item): Item contained in the packet.

sim.base_models.Node.doc: Represents the participants in the blockchain system.

sim.base_models.Node.__init__.doc:
Create a Node object.

  • region (sim.util.Region): Geographic region of the node.
  • timestamp (int): Initial timestamp of the node. Defaults to zero.

sim.base_models.Node.blockchain.doc: A dictionary that stores BTCBlock ids as keys and BTCBlocks as values.

sim.base_models.Node.inbox.doc: Node's inbox with simulation timestamps as keys and lists of Items to be consumed at that timestamp as values.

sim.base_models.Node.ins.doc: Dictionary storing incoming connections. Keys are Node ids and values are Nodes.

sim.base_models.Node.outs.doc: Dictionary storing outgoing connections. Keys are Node ids and values are Nodes.

sim.base_models.Node.last_reveal_times.doc:
Dictionary with node ids as keys and integers as values. Values correspond to the reveal time of the last message sent to the node with the given id.

This is used to simulate links that can only transmit one message at a time. A new message starts transmission only after the previous one has been received.

sim.base_models.Node.step.doc:
Perform one simulation step. Increments its timestamp by 1 and returns the list of Item objects to act on in that step.

  • seconds (float): How many real-time seconds one simulation step corresponds to.

sim.base_models.Node.reset.doc: Reset node state back to simulation start, deleting connections as well.

sim.base_models.Node.send_to.doc:
Send an item to a specific node. Can be used to respond to messages.

  • node (sim.base_models.Node): Target node.
  • item (sim.base_models.Item): Item to send.

sim.base_models.Node.connect.doc:
Establish an outgoing connection to one or more nodes.

  • argv (sim.base_models.Node+): Node(s) to establish connections with.

sim.network_util.get_delay.doc:
Returns the delay (in seconds) of a message between two regions.

  • a (sim.util.Region): Source region.
  • b (sim.util.Region): Destination region.
  • size (float): Message size in bytes.

sim.network_util.latency.doc:
Returns the fixed latency value between two regions.

  • a (sim.util.Region): Source region.
  • b (sim.util.Region): Destination region.

sim.network_util.speed.doc:
Returns the bottleneck bandwidth between two regions. In other words,

min(src_upload, dest_download).

  • a (sim.util.Region): Source region.
  • b (sim.util.Region): Destination region.

sim.util.generate_uuid.doc: Generate UUIDs to use as sim.base_models.Node and sim.base_models.Item ids.

bitcoin.doc: This module extends the core simulator to implement a Bitcoin simulator.

bitcoin.analysis.doc: This module contains various helpers methods to extract statistics from the nodes dumped after a simulation run.

bitcoin.analysis.Analysis.get_all_blocks.doc: Returns list of all blocks seen by all the nodes. nodes (List[Node]): List of nodes in the simulation.

bitcoin.analysis.Analysis.get_longest_ch.doc:
Computes and returns the list of blocks in the longest chain.

  • blocks (Dict[str, Block]): List of all mined blocks.

bitcoin.analysis.Analysis.block_prop_del.doc:
Given a block, computes how much time it took for that block to reach each node.

  • block (Block): Block to calculate propagation times for.
  • nodes (List[Node]): List of all nodes.

bitcoin.analysis.Analysis.block_percenti.doc:
Calculates the time it takes for a block to reach a given percent of the nodes.

  • block (Block): Block to calculate delay for.
  • nodes (List[Node]): List of all nodes.
  • percent (float): Share of blocks to calculate propagation delays for.

bitcoin.analysis.Analysis.stale_block_ra.doc:
Given a node, returns the share of orphan blocks from that node's point of view.

  • node (Miner): Node to calculate stale rate for.

bitcoin.analysis.Analysis.reward_distrib.doc: Returns the total mining rewards collected for each miner as a dictionary with miner names as keys.

bitcoin.analysis.Analysis.transactions_p.doc:
Given the list of all blocks and simulation time in seconds, calculates the rate of transactions per second.

  • blocks (List[Block]): List of all blocks.
  • sim_seconds (int): Total real-world seconds simulated.

bitcoin.analysis.Analysis.avg_block_inte.doc:
Computes the average block interval for blocks in the main chain from the given node's point of view.

  • node (Node): Node to calculate average block interval for.

bitcoin.bookkeeper.Bookkeeper.save_block.doc: Save receipt time of the given block for the given node.

bitcoin.bookkeeper.Bookkeeper.save_tx.doc: Save receipt time of the given transaction for the given node.

bitcoin.bookkeeper.Bookkeeper.get_node_b.doc: Get receipt time of given block for given node.

bitcoin.consensus.Oracle.can_mine.doc: Returns true if the given miner is allowed to mine the given block(s) in the current step. If multiple blocks are provided, should return a boolean list.

bitcoin.consensus.PoWOracle.can_mine.doc: A miner is allowed to mine each block with a certain probability computed with respect to that miner's power, total power, and the expected block interval.

bitcoin.consensus.PoWOracle.compute_tota.doc: Returns the total mining power, iterating over all nodes.

bitcoin.consensus.PoWOracle.get_reward.doc: Returns the mining reward. For PoW, this is a fixed value.

bitcoin.messages.doc: This module contains the various message types that can be sent over the Bitcoin network.

bitcoin.messages.InvMessage.doc: Represents INV messages used to announce new blocks.

bitcoin.messages.InvMessage.__init__.doc:
Create an InvMessage object.

  • item_id (str): Id of the block/transaction being announced.
  • sender_id (str): Id of the sender node. Can be used as a return address.
  • size (float): size of the item in bytes.

bitcoin.messages.GetDataMessage.doc: Represents GET_DATA messages used to request blocks after receiving INV messages.

bitcoin.messages.GetDataMessage.__init__.doc:
Create a GetDataMessage object.

  • item_id (str): Id of the block/transaction being requested.
  • sender_id (str): Id of the sender node. Can be used as a return address.
  • size (float): size of the item in bytes.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.doc: Mining strategies. For performance, although not strictly enforced, we recommend using these classes as singletons.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.NullMining.doc: The default no-mining strategy. Corresponds to the full nodes in Bitcoin.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.NullMining.cho.doc: Returns the head of the longest chain.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.NullMining.gen.doc: Specifies the strategy for mining a new block.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.NullMining.rec.doc:
Specifies the strategy for receiving a block.

The given block is published to the node's peers if relay is True.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.HonestMining.doc: Implements a honest miner following the Bitcoin protocol.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.HonestMining.g.doc:
Generates and returns a Block.

  • prev (Block): Block to build upon. If not provided, the block is chosen according to the protocol.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.HonestMining.r.doc:
Specifies the strategy for receiving a block.

The given block is published to the node's peers if relay is True.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.SelfishMining.doc: Implements a miner launching the selfish mining attack. See https://arxiv.org/abs/1311.0243 for the details.

bitcoin.mining_strategies.SelfishMining..doc: Returns the head of the longest chain.
Specifies the strategy for mining a new block.

Specifies the strategy for receiving a block.

The given block is published to the node's peers if relay is True.

bitcoin.models.Transaction.doc: Represents objects that can be transmitted over a network (e.g. blocks, messages).

bitcoin.models.Transaction.__init__.doc:
Create an Item object.

  • sender_id (str): Id of the sender node. Can be used as a return address.
  • size (float): size of the item in bytes.

bitcoin.models.BTCBlock.__init__.doc:
Create a Block object.

  • miner (Node): Node that created the block.
  • prev_id (str): Id of the block this block was mined on top of.
  • height (int): Height of the block in the blockchain.

bitcoin.models.Miner.__init__.doc:
Create a Miner object.

  • name (str): Human-legible name for the miner. Uniqueness of names is not enforced.
  • mine_power (float): Mining power of the miner, representing what share of the global mining power this miner controls.
  • region (sim.util.Region): Miner's region.
  • iter_seconds (float): How many real-world seconds one simulation step corresponds to.
  • timestamp (int): Used to keep track of the simulation step count. Defaults to 0.

bitcoin.models.Miner.step.doc:
Perform one simulation step. Increments its timestamp by 1 and returns the list of Item objects to act on in that step.

  • seconds (float): How many real-time seconds one simulation step corresponds to.

bitcoin.models.Miner.consume.doc:
Given an Item, performs the necessary action based on its type.

  • item (sim.base_models.Item): Item to consume.

bitcoin.models.Miner.publish_item.doc:
Publishes an item over all of the node's outgoing connections.

  • item (sim.base_models.Item): Item to publish.
  • item_type (str): Item's type (e.g. 'block').

bitcoin.tx_modelings.NoneTxModel.fill_bl.doc: Assign tx count and total size to block.

bitcoin.tx_modelings.SimpleTxModel.gener.doc: Create transaction and add it to shared mempool.

bitcoin.tx_modelings.SimpleTxModel.fill_.doc: Add txs to block from shared mempool until it reaches max size.

bitcoin.tx_modelings.FullTxModel.generat.doc: Create transaction and directly (without inv/getdata) send to all peers.

bitcoin.tx_modelings.FullTxModel.publish.doc: Send transaction either directly (without inv/getdata) or with inv/getdata to all peers

bitcoin.tx_modelings.FullTxModel.receive.doc: Receive transaction, add it local mempool, save its receipt time, and relay to peers.

bitcoin.tx_modelings.FullTxModel.fill_bl.doc: Fill block until reaching max block size.

bitcoin.tx_modelings.FullTxModel.update_.doc: Remove the transactions in the block from the local mempool.
